page.title: 11Information in Cowlinge
page.content: owlinge is served by a 'Library Van' (from the nearby town of Sudbury) which comes into the village for three quarters of an hour every fortnight, and is used by a small percentage of the population. There is also a bi-monthly news sheet The Cowlinge Courier which is free to every house and run by three residents of the village. They rely on donations both literary and monetary to keep this going. Most homes have both radio and television for both entertainment and current news, and there is a daily delivery of newspapers and magazines available to all houses.
